summary: This is an email from defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim to Christian Everdell, likely a co-counsel, regarding logistical concerns for their client Ghislaine Maxwell. Sternheim seeks assistance in ensuring Maxwell has access to her legal materials while in custody and inquires about contacting the court for an order.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, writing an email to coordinate legal logistics regarding Maxwell's access to materials while in custody.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Recipient of the email, likely a co-counsel or legal associate involved in Ghislaine Maxwell's defense.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client in custody, whose access to legal materials while in the cell block is the subject of the attorney's concern.

connections.description: Sternheim is acting as Maxwell's defense attorney, advocating for her access to legal materials while in custody.
Sternheim is corresponding with Everdell, likely as co-counsel or a legal associate, to coordinate on a legal matter for their client.

events.title: Maxwell's Custody Transfer and Access Issue
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell arrived at a detention facility at 5:15 am and was held in the cell block without her legal materials until 8:30 am when she was moved to the fifth floor, prompting her attorney to seek intervention.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody and transferred to a detention facility on the morning of April 13, 2021.
Defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim raised concerns about Maxwell's lack of access to her legal materials while held in the cell block.
Sternheim considered seeking a court order to compel the U.S. Marshals to permit Maxwell access to her legal materials.
